title: Installation issue: quantum-espresso (intel-mkl + openmpi)
body:
Spack builds Quantum Espresso with Open Mpi and the Intel MKL with no errors, but when running `pw.x` I immediately get a segfault:

```
$ module load quantum-espresso-6.5-intel-18.0.5-jpplsyv
$ pw.x
forrtl: severe (174): SIGSEGV, segmentation fault occurred
Image              PC                Routine            Line        Source             
pw.x               0000000000DAEF6D  Unknown               Unknown  Unknown
libpthread-2.17.s  00002AF905210630  Unknown               Unknown  Unknown
libmpi.so.40.20.3  00002AF904A97291  PMPI_Comm_size        Unknown  Unknown
libmkl_blacs_inte  00002AF8FDC8EE29  MKLMPI_Comm_size      Unknown  Unknown
libmkl_blacs_inte  00002AF8FDC8CFF1  mkl_blacs_init        Unknown  Unknown
libmkl_blacs_inte  00002AF8FDC8CF38  Cblacs_pinfo          Unknown  Unknown
libmkl_blacs_inte  00002AF8FDC7D81F  blacs_gridmap_        Unknown  Unknown
libmkl_blacs_inte  00002AF8FDC7D1FE  blacs_gridinit_       Unknown  Unknown
pw.x               0000000000C30F7D  mp_diag_mp_mp_sta          89  mp_diag.f90
pw.x               000000000040E25D  MAIN__                     74  pwscf.f90
pw.x               000000000040E1EE  Unknown               Unknown  Unknown
libc-2.17.so       00002AF90543F555  __libc_start_main     Unknown  Unknown
pw.x               000000000040E0E9  Unknown               Unknown  Unknown

```
It would seem that Spack is linking against the wrong library, `libmkl_blacs_intelmpi_lp64` instead of `libmkl_blacs_openmpi_lp64`.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install quantum-espresso ^openmpi ^intel-mkl
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1483-6d9f026
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-haswell
